alert.note: Alert for Coastal Cumberland; Coastal Waldo; Coastal York; Knox; Lincoln; Sagadahoc (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued January 13 at 3:19AM EST until January 13 at 3:00PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 3 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Very high water levels, perhaps record breaking in some locations, are expected to result in widespread moderate to major coastal flooding. The peak storm surge is expected to reach 3 to 3.5 feet around noontime. * WHERE...In Maine, Coastal York, Coastal Cumberland, Sagadahoc, Lincoln, Knox and Coastal Waldo Counties. In New Hampshire, Coastal Rockingham County. * WHEN...From 9 AM to 3 PM EST Saturday. * There is significant threat to property. Many coastal communities will experience damage. Numerous structures will flood with inundation water depth of up to 3 feet resulting in damage to vulnerable homes and businesses near the waterfront. Numerous road closures expected. A few locations could become isolated due to the flooding of roads. Vehicles parked in vulnerable areas near the waterfront will likely become flooded. A few evacuations may be needed in the most vulnerable areas. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth.
